title: It feels like people don't even WANT to win anymore.
body:
People are giving up so absurdly easy these days that it honestly feels like they don't even want to win, like I can't understand why they're even playing the game.  At this point I'm not sure I want to play anymore games with any random players ever again because of this complete lack of motivation at the slightest disadvantage.

If this keeps up I might actually become toxic to all these people who are giving up all the time.  I don't want to be, but the frustration from having teammates sit in fountains and give up totally winnable games is starting to get to me to the point that I really can't think of words to describe it.

I wish people played like they did several seasons ago.  It felt like there were a lot more "never give up, never surrender" people around, and teams actually made comebacks because they didn't ff.  Yes, I know it's super snowbally these days, but down here in gold, comebacks are incredibly likely with the number of mistakes people make.

Edit:  I'm not saying to never surrender, just that I preferred that mentality over the current one.  I'll certainly ff in a clearly lost game, but many teammates want to ff in games that are close to even these days.

replies.body: You are absolutely right. People don't want to win games, they play to dominate their opponent.

It feels like a symptom of how people perceive the game as well.

"Oh they're 2-0 on us at 5 minutes. GG. Just give up. Surrender. Don't bother at all I know this is a lost game."

At 3 minutes look at each laners cs and KDR, then at 5 minutes, then look at how many of those games you won.
The come back is not very likely these days. Once the score hits about 5 to 9 is when it usually slides away from you.
Comebacks are never supposed to be likely But In playing the game comes the challenge and fun.

I forgot to add team over all attitude.

If they are flaming and toxic , it's done. If they are not flaming, then we have a shot.

This is so true! Sometimes I'm guilty of getting toxic myself. I main jungle/support and can get incredibly frustrated when I'm coming to gank a lane and they die before I even get the chance to make a play, or if I'm supporting an over-aggressive/passive ADC. It's ALWAYS best to say nothing at all than to flame though. Flaming is definitely a surefire way to lose.

I played in an incredibly fun clown fiesta last night! The game actually started out as horrendously awful as it could. We gave up two kills to an invade, then their jungler somehow got three kills during early fighting/skirmishing in mid and top lanes. Team is down 5-0 less than 4 minutes in. I was in a weird bot lane(well by today's standards maybe not weird) with an Annie carry and myself as Brand. I told annie we could bring the game back. Sure enough, we got a couple kills in lane, then turned a 2v4 into a 3 for 0 because for some reason they dove an Annie and Brand under turret and 3 of them got stunned xD. We eventually won the clown fiesta and I think staying positive allowed that!
Of course they are flaming they know flaming is gonna get them what they want the surrender

And sadly "playing to dominate" seems the correct motivation nowadays. Ranked games are coinflip. Matchmaking puts vastly different skill levels into the same game, just to stop one guy who is on a winning streak. And solocarrying feels impossible if only one teammate is performing horribly. Being in a good matchup is more important than ever, so that just alone by the pick position (and random autofill) the game is already favoured for one team.
If you can win by just doing nothing (brain-dead farming, no shotcalling, and sometimes going to where your team pings),
and then loose the next game no matter how hard you try, how well you play?,
And your ladder climbing is not based on your performance, but only based on win or loss of the team?
You might aswell be motivated to dominate you opponent and ff, next when it seems to not work out.

no body wants to be the mighty clicker who clicked the enemy team's sprite models to death 
oh! mean you're probably referring to all the league 14-16 year olds which make most of the player base mmmhmm
Dude, those 14-16 year olds are US, about 4-6 years ago. Everyone left playing is in their 20s now, most likely.

I was on my smurf in gold yesterday, playing jg fid. I handed my team early game, mid game and baron. We are ahead in every possible respect but they won't group for objectives and keep going and doing our jg camps or solo pushing side lanes.

If we walked down mid as 5 we win, I told them that, they kept throwing and wasting time, so I alt-tabbed out and did some online banking. Honestly I was happier to stop playing than I was to try and suppress my frustration and carry that dead weight across the finish line.

There is a point where people don't want to play anymore and forcing them do doesn't to any good for any of us. This game is like a prison sometimes.

I agree, if the team refuses to work together in a **TEAM GAME** then there really is no point in continuing to play, especially when they are ignoring objectives in favor of chasing kills like the monkeys they are.

In Silver and below this is NOT a team game.
Everybody thinks they can carry, everybody wants to be the hero with a triple or quadra kill. The Penta kill is like a wet dream.

Always have 1 or 2 people running around trying to kill everybody when we could win with drag and baron and towers, but no. They need 20/3/5.
Only your first pentakill can fire up some interest, for rest it's like "ow, pentakill, okay".{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

you have to sit and realize its not just a bad game it IS league of legends this is what its about, its about addiction and someone wasting their precious time trying to get a dream team and win then hopefully win again then again till they rot and lose in an endless loop of failure. {{champion:266}}
it will be the same until you realize the game is trash and quit

Exactly, I did the same recently with 2 people going afk. I would like to just leave when they all vote no to FF but then I get reported afk.

So I have to walk around for 10 minutes or more until it ends.

Why did people upvote this post?

"on my smurf in gold," yet you're complaining about your team being bad? Do you not listen to yourself? I'll never understand why people smurf. Isn't the point of the game(or any competitive game) to be challenged?
Well to be fair, riot doesnt make it easy to comeback. Its only natural to try to surr if they see a difficult comeback.
God forbid you work for a difficult comeback
God forbids me if the turrets cant hold out until we reach them in gold.

> [{quoted}](name=VanaQuish,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=h7xKJA67,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-06-15T14:50:30.179+0000)
>
> Well to be fair, riot doesnt make it easy to comeback. Its only natural to try to surr if they see a difficult comeback.

What are you talking about? You read patch notes right? If you don't think its easy to come back let me know what the shutdown gold is for someone and the gold swing that entails if you get a tower or two. Its easier to come back you just need to learn to be efficient on capitalizing on situations.

Shutdown gold is all and good, until you realize that you cant kill them if they are grouped up.  Like how the fk are you supposed to kill them and get the reward, if they are working as a team? You try to split them up? The enemy has eyes and can work around it well, nullify your attempt.

> [{quoted}](name=VanaQuish,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=h7xKJA67,comment-id=000500010000,timestamp=2018-06-15T15:13:10.346+0000)
>
> Shutdown gold is all and good, until you realize that you cant kill them if they are grouped up.  Like how the fk are you supposed to kill them and get the reward, if they are working as a team? You try to split them up? The enemy has eyes and can work around it well, nullify your attempt.

low elo players are not grouped up usually and are most certainly not working as a team
True. But not all of us are in low elo.
it's real pain, when you're good farmed pew-pew killer, and lose just cuz they stay group every second, and have no chance to split them.{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcSUJd3PXNs

So, I've mostly been playing ARAMs (got burnt out early this season), but I pay attention to the League community / watch streams yet of solo que.

If I combine the two, my suspicion is simply that it's the echo chamber effect just being that strong at present. If you consider how people acted when solo que was removed, it was the same basic behavior. Just in this case, it's people going "it's an overpowered one-shot meta, I'm behind, so I don't want a worse KDA. Unlucky. Next game." This is compounded already over the early season feelings of "Why is x position 0/8/0 by this point in my game? We've lost." Even worse if it's at two positions. The game is more team-based; the player base isn't that way. Maybe if Clash had ever gotten to function it might have bolstered the mentality a bit more in a trickle down effect (that's likely optimistic). But that obviously didn't happen.

Games on top of this are assumed quicker (even if statistically way less than the actual---it's what? 22-25 m on average? but players are still quoting the game is over in 8 to 15 minute marks). You might see an improvement based off what's done with crit ADCs, but I feel it's about re-establishing a mindset for the player base for a while instead. Because there's still going to be the idea of---doesn't matter! We won't reach that timer. So unless there's a huge shake-up, I'd expect the same.

Reading the thread about ranked decisions for next season being roughly the same (increase grind/questionable value of other roles) makes me think it may be a long haul though.

 {{sticker:vlad-salute}}

>Games on top of this are assumed quicker (even if statistically way less than the actual---it's what? 22-25 m on average? but players are still quoting the game is over in 8 to 15 minute marks).

Game decided != game duration. The current meta is one of snowball and very few comebacks. A 2K gold lead equates to winning the game 9 out of 10 times, and I really can't fault people for not wanting to play out 15 minutes of getting their face stomped in just in case this is that one game.

Put another way, your time is better spent avoiding the 15 minute stompfest, not getting tilted, and getting back in queue and getting back on the horse. 

If you play NEVAR SURRENDER, you're enduring something like 2 hours of miserable playtime in 10 lost games the off chance you're playing the one turnaround.

> [{quoted}](name=Karunamon,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=h7xKJA67,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2018-06-15T15:42:43.753+0000)
>
> Game decided != game duration. The current meta is one of snowball and very few comebacks. A 2K gold lead equates to winning the game 9 out of 10 times, and I really can't fault people for not wanting to play out 15 minutes of getting their face stomped in just in case this is that one game.
> 
> Put another way, your time is better spent avoiding the 15 minute stompfest, not getting tilted, and getting back in queue and getting back on the horse. 
> 
> If you play NEVAR SURRENDER, you're enduring something like 2 hours of miserable playtime in the off chance you're playing the one turnaround.

I'll start up front by stating that I'm not arguing for the "always play it out" and "you can always win" mentality. Mostly just musing with the community about the mindset of how games feel. Because this thread is essentially "I have demotivated teammates. It sucks to play with the expectation we're going to be giving it our all as a team." Functionally, for many, that's the high they're seeking with League (obviously there's the montage players/skill expression solo-seekers).

What you're expressing is what a solo player will consider for their own mental fortitude/climb. And just looking out on average how it is that games can play out. One of the issues with League is there is the honorable/good Samaritan route as you play with others while also looking at cold facts / skill discrepancies / systematic issues / is it worth it to be honorable to a high extent.  The weighting between the two tends to suggest the bare minimum; it obviously comes out in frustration as players with different mindsets get frustrated over how their teammates are playing (especially if you're not hardcore grinding games a day). {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
I think alotta people are just burnt out of this game

I agree 100% with you on this, but from what I've seen and been told by many players, people are just assuming wins/losses in champ select just through team comps alone (probably because they see a streamer play/play against a champ and claim it's busted and therefore they just see the champ get 1 kill and it's GG to them)
Personally I find enjoyment out of League through long matches where one team gets ahead, and the other team starts playing together and getting good picks until they are able to even the gold lead. So I'm also getting frustrated seeing a surrender vote with 4 green bars 15 minutes in - even if my team is ahead/we have a better late game comp.

I'm just going to hope that people realise comebacks are a possibility and matches aren't always decided by which champs are being played, and learn that not everyone is good at "meta breaking" champs, that they might simply be learning them.

And why wouldn't they give up easily? Even if there is a change for them to win why would you prolong your suffering if you are playing against Irelia and co?
The currently popular (op) champions are insufferable to play against.

From my experience, the first 3 minutes are more critical than ever now.

I used to be able to play for 10 minutes and make a few mistakes and catch my opponent in a mistake and still have a chance to catch up.

Now, if the other team gets ahead 3 or 4 kills and if my lane gets ganked, there is almost no chance that I can ever catch up.

Especially when I play ADC. 


At this point, about 5 minutes in, the game is over for me. It will take 30 minutes of farming and getting flamed to be able to get a few items and contribute.

Once I get sick of listening to all the toxic flaming shit about not going to team fight, I go to the team fight, they all run behind me. Being immobile adc, I get CCed and killed.

So what's the point of even going?


The snowball bullshit is so bad, that if I get 10 cs or 2 kills behind, they push up and gank, kill me and  the lane is lost and they will get one or two towers before I can even get back to lane,  then they go destroy mid with rift herald and the 4 dragons they have.

And I am maybe 1/2/4 at this point, but it is alllllll my fault.

If I have a good support, and we hold bot lane, then we get the 4 man gank and get run over and they take the tower and all go mid, same result.

If I win bot, AND mid wins and roams AND top wins AND jung just doesn't totally fuck up, then we might slowly win. But even then the real risk of throwing the game is ever present. 

Right now, I might lose 5 in a row then win 1 or 2, then lose some more.

So to your point, recent changes and all the snowball bullshit champs make it so there is not much to do when it takes 1 sec to die and then I wait 20 sec and then they do it again.

Just the farm you miss when dead as an adc means 3 death at 5 minutes ends your game. I do my best up to the 3rd death. IF I am 0/3 then that's it, I'm done.

There is no late game anymore, it is all decided at 3 to 5 minutes. I already know if we have a chance to win or not at 3 minutes.

After 5 minutes it is more obvious.

At 10 to 12 minutes even the stupid people can see it. But they still wont FF at 15.

The worst thing is when they are winning lane and think they can carry but we only have 2 or 3 towers left and we slowly lose over 30 minutes.

So yes, when I see it going the wrong way, I just farm and try not to die. I already know we lost and no I don't really care.

I can't care. Back when I was trying my best and people were feeding and throwing I got all tilted and eventually got banned. All that work gone. So now I don't give a shit at all about this game. I play to waste time. Do the win of the day and maybe 2 more and done.

Reason is it takes so much effort to stop a snowball now since 300 gold+tower gold+150 assist gold is so much. One item advantage just means burst now. One fuck up and all that cautiousness in your plays causes you to restart and have to delay longer or just lose the game. That 15 minute stall is all for nothing. 

I'm not justifying what they're doing but if I took a look at their perspective, it's understandable because it isn't a 1-time thing. It happens ALMOST EVERY game. Which is a huge issue in Season 8 and why many don't play ranked or try.

The fun thing about challenger league championship streams: their picks can be quite unusual - and yet since they're so good - it's very hard to predict the outcome.

In lower leagues - if you played long enough - you can predict a loss or a win since champ select.  Last game for example:

My team:

- picks Lucian MID - vs Akali
- picks YASUOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!! Top! VS.  Olaf
Bot lane was actually decent pick: Braum and Draven but since "all team end-up being ad" - they went for tanky builds as expected. 

I TRIED! i FREAKING TRIED! (as ww jungler) - but was close to IMPOSSIBLE!

Would have dodged - but already dodged before and next dodge implies 15 min wait + more lp loss anyway. So i lost (even got demoted) and got heavily tilted cause of those TWO (Top Yasuo + Lucian) and their troll picks.

Not saying that Lucian mid dosn't work. It does in some games - "If you have an APC to compensate". But in this combo - him and Yasuo brought the team down.

I'm not the kind to give-up (if i see a chance), but games like this are HORRID! An AWFUL EXPERIENCE!  In games like this surrender IS the most reasonable option.  Though, 2 of them diddn't (i'm sure it was Yasuo and Lucian). And we were forced to endure another 10 min till they wipe out the base - with no change of doing anything but DIE! And feed the enemy team's EGO! -______________________-
Solo q is 70% champ select. Pro play is 100% champ select. Exp: UZI-KAISA
4fun4 ?

+1 I’ve made threads about this a few times this year. People just want to replay lane phase unti they snowball. The irony being that the other team will ff if they do have a good start.

People counter saying the game is so snowball prone that the game is over at first blood or even champ select. Ya riot needs to fix stuff but the game is winnable. They will say it’s a waste of time, but you don’t just play to win, you play to play. I want to get to full build. The towers are paper so even a team that’s behind can sweep a win if they ace the opponent one time. People are just weak willed and it’s sad.

4 FUN PLAYERS IN 4 FUN REGIONS.


srsly tho fuck your "never give up, never surrender" mentality. 
Nothing tilts me harder than seeing the 0/15 lee say "we can still win". like bitch you couldn't do it in the early game why would that change now that your champ fell off like a brick.

I'm not a "never give up, never surrender"er, I just don't ff quite as easily as most players.  I'll still ff in a clearly lost game (including games that are clearly lost because teammates stop trying).  It just frustrates the hell out of me because many of these "lost" games could be won if the team didn't give up.

only gets worse from here. 
schools out for summer.

If a player dies, it is a teammates fault, ff at 15. reported.

this is very accurate, I got into a game the other day at the 6 min mark my bot/jg wanted to surrender at 6 min playing because they weren't doing well while the mid and I were fine and could carry, which we did eventually

THEN i played another game were no lie at 4min my entire team started typing /ff and ruining around dying the entire team, i couldn't believe it there had been 2 and a half minutes of play time and my whole team gave up and fed till we could surrender fuck that was a terrible time
I personally rarely ever ff a ranked match. It just seems that games are such frustrating stomps nowadays so people give up more.
Or maybe it's you who just don't realize when a game is lost? The game is just snowball. Accept it and stop blaming people for not wanting to waste their lives playing lost games.
Having to play against 4 carries every game can be toxic.

######inb4 a bunch of people show up and start shitposting about how games are over at 10 minutes. 

I can't argue for any elos above gold but I know that in gold people start giving up at 15, 10, and hell even 5 minutes into the game. There's no reason to give up that early, especially not in lower elos. Everyone in low elo makes mistakes that can turn the tide of the game very quickly.
There are many 12 year old turds on ranked doing god knows what, its beyond retarded and just wastes everyones time.
